MCQ: What is the primary unifying theme that explains the diversity of life on Earth?
Choices: a: Cell structure | b: Energy processing | c: Evolution | d: Regulation of internal environments

MCQ: Which of the following is NOT a major theme in biology?
Choices: a: All organisms are made up of cells | b: Organisms use energy to grow and reproduce | c: Life on Earth is static and unchanging | d: Organisms regulate their internal environments

MCQ: What is the name of the process by which organisms pass on hereditary information to their offspring?
Choices: a: Metabolism | b: Evolution | c: Genetics | d: Adaptation

MCQ: Which of the following is an example of a eukaryotic organism?
Choices: a: Bacteria | b: Archaea | c: Fungi | d: Viruses

MCQ: What is the primary method used by biologists to study the world around them?
Choices: a: Observation | b: Scientific method | c: Experimentation | d: All of the above
